alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 24 at 1:33PM PST until February 25 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches, except 1 to 2 feet above 7000 feet near and west of Highway 89. Winds gusting as high as 90 mph along the Sierra ridgelines with gusts up to 35 mph in the Tahoe Basin. Waves 2 to 4 feet on Lake Tahoe. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet at lake level, and 3 to 5 feet above 7000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 90 mph along the Sierra ridgelines. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday morning through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible through Tuesday night. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
